title: Mass. actually had 4 tornadoes Saturday, says National Weather Service
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Four EF1 tornadoes touched down in Central Massachusetts on Saturday, confirmed by the National Weather Service.
The tornadoes, linked to a severe thunderstorm, impacted Paxton, Holden, Berlin, and Stow.
NWS reported widespread damage including downed trees and power outages; no tornados found in Otis and Blandford.

title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks in September
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix adds 1981 film 'The Four Seasons' featuring Alan Alda and Carol Burnett to its streaming selection.
New series 'The Paper,' a spinoff of 'The Office,' debuts on Peacock, with a second season confirmed.
HBO Max features 'Friendship,' starring Tim Robinson as a suburban dad befriending neighbor Paul Rudd.

title: On the hunt for sharks in Boston Harbor
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Researchers from the Anderson Cabot Center for Ocean Life are tagging juvenile sand tiger sharks in Boston Harbor.
The tagging aims to help designate the area as a 'Habitat Area of Particular Concern' by NOAA Fisheries.
Sand tiger sharks are critically endangered with declining populations due to overfishing and low reproductive rates.

title: Police seek help finding alleged shooter who escaped on scooter
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Police seek public's help identifying a suspect in an Aug. 16 Dorchester shooting near 326 Harvard St.
The suspect, who shot the victim multiple times, fled the scene on a scooter toward Walk Hill Street.
Witnesses describe the suspect as wearing a white shirt, blue jeans, and possibly a helmet.

title: Best food events around Boston and New England for fall 2025
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: The Big E fair in West Springfield offers a variety of treats, from fried Oreos to regional specialties like baked Maine potatoes.
Somerville's Union Square will host the What the Fluff? Festival, featuring games, live music, and Fluff-centered foods on Sept. 20.
High Street Place Fall Fest in downtown Boston will include pumpkin decorating, seasonal bites, and an Oktoberfest beer garden on Sept. 27.

title: Emmy nominee Jeff Hiller joins the latest episode of the Love Letters podcast
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Jeff Hiller, Emmy nominee for 'Somebody Somewhere', shares a breakup story on the Love Letters podcast with Meredith Goldstein.
Hiller discusses lessons learned from a troubling relationship in his 20s, resonating with listeners of varying ages.
The podcast episode also highlights iconic romantic and breakup scenes from movies like 'When Harry Met Sally' and 'Notting Hill'.

title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, is charged with kidnapping and murdering his 38-year-old sister, Michelle Knox, in Lynn.
Smith pleaded not guilty in Lynn District Court on Monday; case records are impounded and not publicly available.
Smith has a criminal history, having pleaded guilty to assault with a dangerous weapon in July, among other charges.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Harold Landry had 2.5 sacks in a 20-13 loss to the Raiders, showcasing defensive potential.
New England's defense contained Raiders' run game but allowed 362 passing yards, including nine 20+ yard plays.
Patriots' offseason signings, including Harold Landry and Milton Williams, contributed significantly to the pass rush.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews criticized the Patriots' run game performance in their season-opening 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots gained only 60 rushing yards from 18 attempts, failing to leverage expected key players Stevenson and Henderson.
New England's offensive strategy shifted as Drake Maye threw 46 passes while the run game struggled against the Raiders.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm will lead his first Bruins training camp, emphasizing intensity and accountability for the team.
The Bruins seek improvement after a disappointing 33-39-10 season, focusing on defense and power play enhancements.
Sturm's straightforward communication style aims to motivate both seasoned veterans and younger players.
